intro: Faramea laxula, commonly known as the slender faramea, is a tropical shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often fragrant, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
